frame.name: Tolerating
frame.definition:
<def-root>The words in this frame describe an <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feelings of tolerating with respect to some <fen>Content</fen>. A <fen>Reason</fen> for the toleration may also be expressed. Although the <fen>Content</fen> may refer to an actual, current state of affairs, quite often it refers to a general situation which causes the emotion.
<ex> <fex name="Experiencer">He</fex> could not <t>tolerate</t> <fex name="Content">the smell of coconut</fex> . </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Experiencer
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences tolerance with respect to the <fen>Content</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root><fen>Content</fen> is what the <fen>Experiencer</fen>'s feeling of tolerance is directed towards.. The <fen>Content</fen> differs from a stimulus because the <fen>Content</fen> is not construed as being direcly responsible for causing the emotion. <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">Everyone</fex> must <t>endure</t> <fex name="Content">some disappointments in life</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Explanation
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Explanation</fen> is the explanation for why an <fen>Experiencer</fen> tolerates the <fen>Content</fen>. <ex> Spouses often <t>tolerate</t> their partner's vices <fex name="Explanation">because they love the overall person</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Parameter
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Parameter</fen> is a domain in which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> tolerates the <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Parameter">Intellectual</fex> <t>tolerance</t> is a very important trait to have in this field.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Topic
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Topic</fen> is the area about which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> has the tolerated experience(s). <ex> <fex name="Experiencer">They</fex> 're very <t>tolerant</t> <fex name="Topic">about boys' mess in the home and untidiness generally</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: State
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>State</fen> is the abstract noun that describes a more lasting experience by the <fen>Experiencer</fen>. <ex>Tracy was in a surprisngly <t>tolerant</t> <fex name="State">mood</fex> today.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Event
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Event</fen> is the occasion or happening that <fen>Experiencer</fen>s in a certain emotional state participate in. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> FE encodes the circumstances or conditions under which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> experiences the emotion. Unlike <fen>Content</fen> it does not give the specific content of the emotion, but the <fen>Content</fen> can often be inferred from the <fen>Circumstances</fen>.</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition:
<def-root>The time at which the <fen>Experiencer</fen> is in the state of toleration.
<ex><fex name="tim">When they are young,</fex>, they cannot <t>stand</t> extremes of temperature. </ex> </def-root>

lexUnit.name: endure.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to stand, undergo without failing

lexUnit.name: tolerant.a
lexUnit.definition: FN: able to accept or tolerate

lexUnit.name: toleration.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: the capacity or tendency to accept or endure (something that might be a problem or difficulty)

lexUnit.name: tolerate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: to accept or withstand (something which might be a problem or dificulty)
